intro: Micromeria cymuligera, commonly known as the desert sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a small, annual herb that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant has slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs, and its small, clustered flowers are usually pink to purple in color. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Micromeria cymuligera is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in harsh desert conditions.
